title: Average value of a function on an interval

content.question: If the average value of a continuous function f on the interval [−2, 4 ] is 12, what is <math> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow> <mn>4</mn> </msubsup> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> <mn>8</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle></mrow> </math> dx?

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
